column1: At a time when our economy is suffering under the #COVID19 pandemic our recent reauthorization of the National Apprenticeship Act which included additional funding for expansion will help create jobs & put people back to work in a learning environment. https://t.co/nWW3Iqp3aA

As we work to combat the opioid epidemic #COVID19 has only exacerbated factors contributing to opioid abuse. This recently approved bill provides $5 billion to help states tackle the growing problem and work towards the goal of saving lives. https://t.co/48j9NbDQVu

The US economy is dependent on the nation taking COVID seriously & reducing the spread. These travel restrictions hurt our economy & separate loved ones. We have a President who is consumed with conspiracies rather than casualties. Let's do our part to look out for one another https://t.co/Rj2JXX4JgB

REMINDER: Today is the FINAL day for WNY Fire Departments to apply for #CARESAct #COVID19 relief.  Applications are due before 5pm.  For additional information about this funding opportunity please visit: https://t.co/B9pbtJM6P1
COVID cases are rising in WNY at an alarming rate. Please take this seriously. We must act now to protect our families and neighbors. #WearaMask #SocialDistance #WashYourHands https://t.co/plxVxR0fDl
@magziesb Click here for a map of COVID testing sites in Erie County: https://t.co/SH5inUJEp4

Today we joined @ATT to announce a new Virtual Field Trip program that will help communicate the importance of WNY history & culture to our community's youth during #COVID19 through collaborations with some of our community’s most important cultural institutions. @MobilizeNY https://t.co/JOjKH4xYnQ

Attention Erie County Small Business Owners: Today is the last day to apply for federal COVID relief through the Back to Business Grant Program. $20 million provided through the #CARESAct will be distributed.  Visit: https://t.co/a5ZnklOQjW

It is the duty of the federal gov to keep Americans safe during a natural disaster. The House-passed #HeroesAct was a start not a finish to negotiations on #COVID19 disaster relief. The Senate has failed to act & there is no excuse for this lack of action https://t.co/XIYkQH9kOp
REMINDER: Local Fire Departments may apply until Nov.13 for #CARESAct #COVID19 relief funding.  For more information: https://t.co/PxeEuBSsY6

The #COVID19 crisis has made it clear access to reliable high-speed broadband is essential for all Americans. But as millions rely on their internet for work or school the #Trump @FCC voted once again to gut #netneutrality and prioritize corporate profits over public good. https://t.co/lIissTRN22

As long as the President rejects scientific facts calls medical experts ‘idiots’ & politicizes common sense protocols coronavirus cases will rise lives will be lost & Americans will be an unwelcome health threat to our allies around the world.  US-Canada travel ban statement: https://t.co/UGpuZ1pNdj

The #COVID19 pandemic has been devastating to small businesses & the jobs they support. Today Erie County launched the Back to Business Grant program providing federal #CARESAct funding to help local small businesses get back on their feet. For more info: https://t.co/IBW1E58OQW https://t.co/SrUzSNNUR0

Last night the House approved the updated #HeroesAct based on bipartisan provisions in the CARES Act which provides relief to communities & invests $75 billion in coronavirus testing and contract tracing. The Senate can no longer ignore the need to act. https://t.co/YFfGTY2SrM

News that the President and First Lady have tested positive for COVID-19 is an urgent reminder that everyone is vulnerable. While we wish the first couple a speedy recovery these results should be a wake-up call to the Administration & us all to take this virus seriously. https://t.co/DDdw3FBFuY

We fully agree. The updated #HeroesAct would provide #COVID19 relief to families communities & businesses struggling due to the current crisis including $2.2T to address economic & health needs with direct relief to Americans & local municipalities. https://t.co/uLip2sPmG5 https://t.co/cKhgUDIWAa

The mental health of our friends and family is a serious matter one that's exacerbated by the #COVID19 pandemic. During #SuicidePreventionMonth four newly approved bills will advance efforts to provide communities with better access to support resources. https://t.co/JjBZlXBTgT

The U.S. has just 4.25% of the world’s population but our friends neighbors and family members represent close to 21% of the world’s deaths due to #COVID19.  President Trump isn't taking this pandemic seriously and as a result the US has the highest death toll in the world. https://t.co/ysYVRp1EpT

Tragically the US will soon surpass #200KDeadAmericans due to #COVID19. The pandemic has placed millions of Americans & communities in economic peril. The federal response has been chaotic. We can & must do better. The #HeroesAct addressed this urgency - the Senate must act now.

While our communities and families are struggling due to #COVID19 the House passed the Moving Forward Act to help create millions of good-paying American jobs #ForThePeople and provide a robust $1.5 trillion federal infrastructure investment that will stimulate the economy. https://t.co/E5iRE2FTr8

Free #COVID19 saliva tests available to Niagara Falls residents today made possible thanks to Community Development Block Grand Funding provided  to the City of Niagara Falls through the CARES Act. https://t.co/8VOQzeyTJj

Reports indicate the travel ban between the US & Canada set to expire on 9/21 will be extended - a consequence of the President’s failed response to COVID. We won’t have a healthy economy until we have a healthy country & it starts w/ the President taking this virus seriously. https://t.co/Q5JCrW7Gqq

Today we joined @Brian_Kulpa to express great concern over the failure to provide federal aid to our state and local governments fighting #COVID19. This virus is a national problem that needs a national solution. The cost of inaction is dire: homelessness layoffs and hunger. https://t.co/sso4ZpZsNS

State & local governments have been at the front end providing #COVID19 response due to a lethargic disengaged federal response.  The Trump Administration has a responsibility to provide state & local aid to the municipalities who have borne the costs of this national emergency. https://t.co/e6nZtQvjMy

Trump's response to #COVID19 was slow sloppy & adversarial. Because of it Americans aren’t welcome in Canada & 27 European countries. We need this Administration to take the pandemic seriously so we can open the US-Canada border. https://t.co/mYtMWS7tSu https://t.co/NvUit3l98u

NEW: An additional +$9M in #CARESAct relief funding will be provided to help local communities that have been fighting this pandemic respond to and recover from the #COVID19 outbreak. The #COVID19 pandemic has taken a considerable financial toll on small businesses in Erie & Niagara County. A newly awarded $6M in #CARESAct funding will provide relief to local entrepreneurs struggling through this difficult time. @ECIDANY @NiagaraBiz https://t.co/YLvMFIfk0l

As COVID-19 began its assault on Americans' lives @realdonaldtrump knew of its severity. He secretly stated as much to Bob Woodward. But publicly he downplayed the very dangers he knew Americans faced. This shameless dereliction of duty must not stand. #TrumpKnew https://t.co/w3ZzSgHCKO
Western New York: We each have a role to play in slowing the spread of #COVID19 and protecting this community we love.  Be smart. Be safe. #WearAMask https://t.co/yxfatSAmjY

As COVID continues to spread the Trump Admin. continues to fail the American people.  CDC flip-flopping on testing guidelines degrades the public's trust in US public health institutions.  Trump's slow down on testing will lead to a sicker America. https://t.co/VZ1qN1OZlj

#COVID testing cannot be limited just to those that show symptoms or those who can afford it.  More on the recent decision by insurance companies to stop covering the costs of some testing and the Administration’s loophole that allows companies to do it  https://t.co/ugW5lw1Gtt

A decision by local health insurance companies to back away from #COVID testing coverage will make WNY a sicker place in the long run resulting in higher costs for all payers. This is an abdication of their responsibility to their customers and our community as a whole. https://t.co/V9oc9LfsCl

This Administration's failure to lead on a national testing plan is now compounded by the creation of a loophole allowing private insurance companies to get away with not covering #COVID testing in some circumstances. These barriers come as we need more testing not less. https://t.co/YdzE2m467i

$417000+ in #CARESAct funding awarded to the City of Buffalo Fire Department for #COVID protective equipment. This emergency federal aid protects our Buffalo Firefighters as they protect our City. https://t.co/VN2AKzD57W https://t.co/WkDCom8cfv

PASSED: the Delivering for America Act.  ✅Prohibiting operational changes to the USPS during the COVID pandemic  ✅Providing the $25 billion in funding the Postal Service requested  ✅Blocking this #PostmasterDisaster  #DontMessWithUSPS   https://t.co/UC1qKvawxc
Poor management of the COVID pandemic by the Trump Administration extends restrictions along the Northern Border for another month https://t.co/QAosSE1pwp

Executive orders side stepping our Country's current problems aren't enough. We need to pass the #HEROESAct to ensure Americans have the resources required to deal with the #covid19 pandemic head on this includes stopping unemployment from ballooning. https://t.co/uxI3AcxBLJ

As we celebrate 55 years of the #VotingRightsAct our work to ensure access to the ballot isn’t over. Congress must pass the John R. Lewis Voting Rights Act and we must give states the resources they need to #ProtectOurVote amid the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/2YTADLYnOI

Historic Tax Credits will play an important role in the economic recovery communities need in the wake of the current pandemic.  We pushed for & won an extension for #HTC applicants who saw construction slowdowns due to COVID.  This change will allow WNY projects to move forward. https://t.co/9PpXIGMhC1

For working parents child care is essential. It's also expensive and can be difficult to find. We must work to improve this especially now as we face a public health and economic crisis. The House will continue to push for this. #Covid19 #HeroesAct https://t.co/9QfXEdCoWs

Sadly today we surpass 150000 deaths due to #COVID.  Testing and tracing is the best tool we have to limit the spread.  The #HeroesAct provides the necessary funding for a national strategy to test and trace cases.  The other plan fails to take this seriously. https://t.co/eh3tFYX6yV
Food is not a luxury it's a necessity.  COVID has made it more difficult for individuals families children and seniors to access food.  The #HeroesAct delivers for the hungry. https://t.co/8X2sOZY2Aj

State & local governments have taken on enormous costs in response to the #COVID pandemic.  Residents will be forced to pay the price - tax increases service cuts job losses - if communities don't receive the federal emergency funding they deserve.  The #HeroesAct delivers. https://t.co/iQb9EdwgoY

Today our team joined @ATUComm Local 1342 for a rally supporting a fair contract for Western New York transit workers who have served on the frontlines to maintain services to our community throughout the COVID pandemic.  #EssentialWorkers #nozeroesforheroes https://t.co/SBHHc87bS5
